Key Match Events: Indonesia earned their first points in the competition by converting a decisive penalty versus a wasteful Vietnam side
Indonesia captain Asnawi Bahar stepped up to take the penalty and smashed it into the top left corner
Vietnam's Le Pham Thanh received a red card for a sliding challenge on Ferdinan in the 90th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesia defender Walsh said: 'It's a massive win for us, for all the effort we've put in the last couple of months and even the last couple of years. It's positive for us, an amazing feeling to have three points in the bag.'

Walsh added: 'Let's just enjoy this moment! It's a massive three points for us in this Asia cup with a tough group. Anything is possible, we go with a good feeling toward the match with Japan. They are an amazing team but we can try to do something and it will be a great experience for us.'
Vietnam face group leaders Iraq but their campaign looks to be pretty much over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia opened the match with ferocious aggression that caught the Vietnamese off guard
Vietnam continued to give away possession as manager Philippe Troussier became increasingly frustrated on the sidelines
Vietnamâ€™s best opportunity of the match came early after the break, as Van Tung Nguyen failed to convert a point-blank finish at full stretch
Others: Indonesia's medical team deployed a stretcher for the wounded defender after the player was struck by an elbow, his face bleeding
